title: Usb Install Windows 7 x86, x64, and XP

forumNotes.author: Joeye
forumNotes.content:
Hi I want to create a usb drive with the instalation of windows 7 x86, x64 and xp. Is this possible ? Which tools should i use to make the multiboot menu ? also can i add a livexp a hirens boot and a linux distro to the pen ?
Thanks in advance Best Regards

forumNotes.author: evilgoat
forumNotes.content:
i'm working on the exact same project, although i included a kaspersky rescue disk as well. anyways, the point that i got to was getting everything on except hiren's, the reason is that winxp takes about 2 hours to install from stick if the file system is fat32, it works fine if you change it to ntfs but hiren's boot cd dosn't work from ntfs. anyways, to get everything on except hiren's this is what i did: first copy your xp from cd or unpack from image and follow the instructions in step 2 XP-Source Preparation in this guide here: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=4900](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=4900 "External link") namely the integration of the masstorage driver pack into the build to minimize risk of errors while installing on different types of hards. then follow the first part of this guide here: [http://www.boot-land...?...=11930\&st=0](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=11930&st=0 "External link") but in step 7 choose to format the stick as ntfs instead of fat32, in step 11 choose the folder where you have the xp setup files you modified earlier and in step 13 don't copy anything, rather create a menu.lst that looks like this: color white/black white/blue default /default title Install Windows XP root (hd0,0) configfile /winsetup.lst savedefault title Install Windows 7 root (hd0,0) chainloader /bootmgr and create a winsetup.lst that looks like this: color white/black white/blue default /default
title first part root (hd0,0) chainloader (hd0,0)/$WIN_NT$.\~BT/SETUPLDR.BIN savedefault 1 title second part root (hd0,0) chainloader (hd0,0)/NTLDR savedefault btw i'm not sure if all are like that but there are images out there with windows 7 x86 and x64 in one, grab one of those for this. add the live xp image using make_usb.exe from [http://wimb.winbuild...ad=U_XP_SET.exe](http://wimb.winbuilder.net/downloads/?dir=&download=U_XP_SET.exe "External link") . all you need to specify in this tool is the drive letter of the usb stick in "boot image file" the path to the livexp_wim.iso (you can uncheck "copy u_xp_set folder") and hit go. i'm not sure if this appends to or replaces your menu.lst but in any case it should look like this: title Boot LiveXP map (hd0,0)/LiveXP_WIM.ISO (0xff) map --hook root (0xff) chainloader (0xff) title Install Windows XP root (hd0,0) configfile /winsetup.lst savedefault title Install Windows 7 root (hd0,0) chainloader /bootmgr as for the linux ... depends which one you want to use.
